definitions.definition: Firm in standing or position; not tottering or shaking; fixed ; firm .
examples: Hold the ladder steady while I go up.

definitions.definition: Constant in feeling, purpose, or pursuit; not fickle, changeable, or wavering; not easily moved or persuaded to alter a purpose; resolute .
examples: a man steady in his principles, in his purpose, or in the pursuit of an object

definitions.definition: Smooth and not bumpy or with obstructions.
Phlegmatic , calm ; not easily upset , excited , or disturbed .

examples: the steady course of the Sun;  a steady breeze of wind

definitions.definition: With whom one is going steady .
Confident and cool-headed under pressure; competent ; reliable , adept .

main_definition: Firm in standing or position; not tottering or shaking; fixed ; firm .
secondary_definitions: Constant in feeling, purpose, or pursuit; not fickle, changeable, or wavering; not easily moved or persuaded to alter a purpose; resolute .
Smooth and not bumpy or with obstructions.
Phlegmatic , calm ; not easily upset , excited , or disturbed .
( informal , dated ) With whom one is going steady .
( Singapore , Singlish , predicative ) Confident and cool-headed under pressure; competent ; reliable , adept .
